Section Header:
You are invited to take part in a program being undertaken by the Maternal and reproductive Health Research Collective, a non-governmental organization that works to strengthen maternal health delivery services through research and initiatives. Before you decide whether to participate, you need to understand why this program is being done and what it would involve. Please take the time to read or listen as I read the following information. You may talk to others about the program if you wish. Please ask me if there is anything unclear or if you would like more information. When all your questions have been answered and you feel you understand this program and would like to participate, please sign this form, and provide us with a working phone number. You have the option to decline to participate at any point in the program. Purpose of the Program and Requirements.
What is MAMABASE? This program seeks to identify, register and support pregnant women within low-income communities through pregnancy to deliver safely and healthily that protect their dignity and well-being. The first phase of Mamabase will commence with capturing indigent pregnant women. This program will occur in slum communities in all LGAs in Lagos State.
Why have I been invited to take part? You have been invited to take part because you are a pregnant woman living in Lagos state who is expected to be utilizing maternal health services.
What will happen if I take part? If you agree to participate in the program, we will ask you to sign this form. You will also be asked to provide some personal information like the details of your pregnancy, reproductive history and some demographic information. After which you will be linked to a PHC closest to you and be provided with financial and medical support needed throughout the pregnancy period.
Field Label: Do you agree to participate in this study?
